author: Moneylife Digital Team
title: Food Inflation
text: Follow @mldigital Combined food inflation was 2.92% for August 2015, compared to 2.81% recorded for July 2015. For rural and urban areas, food inflation was 3.59% and 1.71%, respectively, in August. Vegetable prices declined by 6.36% year-on-year (y-o-y) in August, due to a high base effect. Inflation in fruit prices was 0.99% in August, while pulses were dearer by 25.76% y-o-y. Inflation for cereals stood at 1.22% and inflation for milk products was 5.33%. Price rise of non-vegetarian items, such as meat and fish, was 5.79% in August compared to 6.94% in July 2015. More in Moneylife
